settingsPane.description: The following settings are for all global CPU configuration, use it only if you know what you are doing.
settingsPane.name: CPU Global Settings

seekBar.description: Maximum CPU Speed ALERT 1.5Ghz and 1.6Ghz can be unstable for your personal device! so try it, if stuck(SOD), then your CPU will not work on such high OC, nothing can be done! for others it's working fine. (default is 1200000)
seekBar.name: scaling_max_freq

seekBar.description: Minimum CPU Speed (default is 200000)
seekBar.name: scaling_min_freq

spinner.description: This sets the smooth scaling level which prevents ondemand based governors to jump directly to maximum frequency, with load spikes. This setting will only change the behavior of ondemand, HYPER, Sleepy, Scary and pegasusq governors.
spinner.name: Smooth Scaling Level

spinner.description: Sets the number of CPUs to be used in hotplugging (only for PegasusQ)
spinner.name: Max CPU Lock

spinner.description: This will set the AWAKE (screen ON) CPU governor. Default CPU governor will only be set during early stages of booting (before init.d execution), and can be overridden by later scripts or apps.
spinner.name: Default CPU Governor

seekBar.description: second core will be enabled when the load goes above this threshold, if you set above 24, and you have 800Mhz as MAX, second core will not turn ON!. if you set freq lower than 800Mhz Second core is DISABLED! (default is 23)
seekBar.name: load_h0

seekBar.description: second core will be disabled when the load goes below this threshold (default is 30)
seekBar.name: load_l1

seekBar.description: (default is 2)
seekBar.name: min_rq

seekBar.description: (default is 20)
seekBar.name: load_rq

seekBar.description: Sets hot plug sampling intervals for screen-on state (default is 100)
seekBar.name: rate

seekBar.description: Sets the frequency below which second core will not be turned on, regardless of thresholds. (default: 600000)
seekBar.name: freq_min

settingsPane.description: These settings control CFS (Complete Fair Scheduler) Task Scheduler Settings
settingsPane.name: CFS Settings

checkbox.description: Disabling GENTLE_FAIR_SLEEPERS may give you better UI responsiveness. so NOT checked is GOOD.
checkbox.name: GENTLE FAIR SLEEPERS
checkbox.label: GENTLE FAIR SLEEPERS

checkbox.description: Using ARCH_POWER enables the use of arm topology power functions instead of generic ones, and saves battery. normally do not disable.
checkbox.name: ARCH POWER
checkbox.label: ARCH POWER

settingsPane.description: Here you can set all the settings for power save!
settingsPane.name: CPU Idle and Power Settings

spinner.description: Sets the CPU undervolting/overvolting value which will be set during boot time only. !ALERT! -100 and -75 can brake the boot or shutdown the CPU! 'SOD', So dont post about it if you stuck after messing with this control! It's will not have any effect until you restart your device. Remember: if you change this value and your device doesn't boot! you will have to reset stweaks settings using CWM recovery. This value will be applied to all CPU steps before any script or app execution. If you use any script or voltage control app this setting may be overridden by those.
spinner.name: CPU Undervolting

spinner.description: Sets the CPU Idle Mode. for best stability use Idle + LPA
spinner.name: CPU Idle Mode

seekBar.description: Sets the sched_mc value which changes the cpu scheduler behavior for multi-cpu systems. 0 is Samsung kernel's default value which turns sched_mc off. Setting it to 1 means that the first core will be fully loaded before SEC CPU will start, and setting it to 2 will bias task wake-ups to semi-idle cpu package for power savings. (default: 0)
seekBar.name: sched_mc

seekBar.description: This is for CPU BUS-FREQ UP-FREQ-Scaling, based on CPU load! default=80%
seekBar.name: busfreq_up_threshold

seekBar.description: Maximum DEEP SLEEP CPU Speed default is Kernel default 600000, Samsung Default 800000! too low freq will stuck your device!)
seekBar.name: scaling_max_suspend_freq

seekBar.description: Minimum DEEP SLEEP CPU Speed (default is 200000)
seekBar.name: scaling_min_suspend_freq

seekBar.description: Minimum Standby (music palying on screen off) CPU Speed, (default is 200000kHz) if music still shutter, rise to 300000/400000kHz
seekBar.name: scaling_min_standby_freq

seekBar.description: For dev debug only! you can add small delay to cortex wakeup/sleep script, this will delay all function changesand the wakeup! normally say 0 here.
seekBar.name: Cortex Wakeup Delay

seekBar.description: Here you can change Cortex Wakeup Boost, it's give you full power of CPU and System but only for time that set, then all back to normal
seekBar.name: Cortex Wakeup Boost

spinner.description: This will set the DEEP-SLEEP (screen OFF) CPU governor, depend on cortex background process ON.
spinner.name: Deep-Sleep! CPU Governor

settingsPane.description: GPU Frequency/voltage/steps/utilization Settings. Defaults frequencies are 108, 160, 200, 267 and 267. Voltage defaults are 900mV, 950mV, 1000mV, 1000mV and 1000mV.
settingsPane.name: GPU Control

checkbox.description: Enabling VPLL mode may be unstable on some devices so do not complain if your device LAG or Crash 'SOD'. If you do not use VPLL Mode frequency steps 330, 440, 520 will be unavailable. VPLL is a new FREQ Range to give some users more GPU performance!
checkbox.name: VPLL Mode
checkbox.label: VPLL Mode

seekBar.description: Here you can change GPU utilization timeout! as close to 100(1sec) you get faster GPU response in steps jump on load. but more battery drained, CM10 default 250(2.5sec)
seekBar.name: GPU Utilization Timeout

spinner.description: Changes the first (lowest) GPU frequency step
spinner.name: GPU Freq Step1

spinner.description: Changes the second GPU frequency step
spinner.name: GPU Freq Step2

spinner.description: Changes the third GPU frequency step Note freq 400 need 1100mV~1200mV, above 1200mV you risk to burn your chip
spinner.name: GPU Freq Step3

spinner.description: Changes the fourth GPU frequency step, Note freq 400,440,520 need 1100mV~1200mV, above 1200mV you risk to burn your chip
spinner.name: GPU Freq Step4

spinner.description: Changes the fifth GPU frequency step, Note freq 400,440,520 need 1100mV~1200mV, above 1200mV you risk to burn your chip
spinner.name: GPU Freq Step5

settingsPane.description: GPU Voltage Levels: The defaults are 900, 950, 950, 1000 and 1050, voltage above 1200mV put your device on risk! do not blame me if GPU chip burn.
settingsPane.name: GPU Voltage Levels

seekBar.description: GPU Voltage for the first step
seekBar.name: GPU Voltage Level1

seekBar.description: GPU Voltage for the second step
seekBar.name: GPU Voltage Level2

seekBar.description: GPU Voltage for the third step
seekBar.name: GPU Voltage Level3

seekBar.description: GPU Voltage for the fourth step
seekBar.name: GPU Voltage Level4

seekBar.description: GPU Voltage for the fifth step
seekBar.name: GPU Voltage Level5

settingsPane.description: GPU load thresholds to change between frequency steps.
settingsPane.name: GPU Thresholds

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump up from first to second step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 1-UP

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump down from second to first step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 2-DOWN

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump up from second to third step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 2-UP

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump down from third to second step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 3-DOWN

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump up from third to fourth step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 3-UP

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump down from fourth to third step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 4-DOWN

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump up from fourth to fifth step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 4-UP

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump down from fifth to fourth step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 5-DOWN

settingsPane.description: Brightness Curve settings which modify auto-brightness behavior.
settingsPane.name: Brightness Curve

seekBar.description: Sets touch screen move sensitivity (vitalij value).
seekBar.name: TouchMove Sensitivity

seekBar.description: Setting min_bl higher will result in staying lowest brightness level for brighter conditions (default 30)
seekBar.name: min_bl

seekBar.description: Minimum brightness level (default 0)
seekBar.name: min_gamma

seekBar.description: Maximum brightness level (default 24)
seekBar.name: max_gamma

checkbox.description: LCD Power Reduce for backlight, default ON, if you like more brighter screen, in cost of battery drain, then turn it off
checkbox.name: LCD POWER
checkbox.label: LCD POWER REDUCE

settingsPane.description: Settings for screen color by user manual input
settingsPane.name: Screen Color Menu

button.description: Push to reset screen color to default
button.name: Reset Color to Default
button.label: Default Color

seekBar.description: Sets screen BLUE color scale (Default is 127)
seekBar.name: Blue Color Scale

seekBar.description: Sets screen RED color scale (Default is 127)
seekBar.name: Red Color Scale

checkbox.description: mDNIe sharpness tweaks from hardcore. Requires reboot to be effective.
checkbox.name: mDNIe Sharpness Tweaks by GM!
checkbox.label: mDNIe Sharpness Tweaks

settingsPane.description: Other Settings
settingsPane.name: Other Settings

seekBar.description: User adjustable gamma shift.
seekBar.name: Gamma Shift

seekBar.description: FB earlysuspend delay to run CRT animation when you turn the screen off.
seekBar.name: FB Earlysuspend Delay

seekBar.description: Vibration force level (default 75)
seekBar.name: Vibration Force

checkbox.description: Slide2Wake By Fluxi@xda, when screen is OFF swipe from left side of screen to right side of screen, and screen will be turned ON!
checkbox.name: Slide2Wake ON/OFF Switch
checkbox.label: Slide2Wake Switch

checkbox.description: Enable inverting the screen colors by quickly pressing Home button below configured times
checkbox.name: mDNIe Negative Toggle
checkbox.label: mDNIe Negative Toggle

spinner.description: Negative Color, Screen effect settings, Fast Click MENU for number of times configured to activate MOD
spinner.name: Negative Screen Mod tuning.

settingsPane.description: Here you can control kernel screen gestures, set at /data/gesture_set.sh, more can be added by user, this tweak depend on cortex background service ON
settingsPane.name: Gestures Panel

checkbox.description: Here you can turn on/off kernel build in gestures! see OP for instructions/ask in forum.
checkbox.name: Gestures switch
checkbox.label: GESTURES SWITCH

button.description: Click to reset gestures to default, or update with new one from dev, gesture file will be added to `/data/` only once if was missing.
button.name: RESET GESTURES
button.label: Reset Gestures

settingsPane.description: Touch screen configuration on BATT and on CHARGE, !ALERT! wrong set will disable touch screen! and you will have too reset profiles in recovery! Also settings for Battery VS Charger are different! do not set the same levels! have fun tuning.
settingsPane.name: Touch Screen Sensitivity

seekBar.description: Touch Screen on BATTERY (Touch Treshold) (default=50)
seekBar.name: BATT Touch Treshold

seekBar.description: Touch Screen on BATTERY (Noise Treshold) (default=40)
seekBar.name: BATT Noise Treshold

seekBar.description: Touch Screen on BATTERY (Move Filter) (default=12)
seekBar.name: BATT Move Filter

seekBar.description: Touch Screen on CHARGER/USB (Touch Treshold) (default=53)
seekBar.name: CHRG Touch Treshold

seekBar.description: Touch Screen on CHARGER/USB (Noise Treshold) (default=38)
seekBar.name: CHRG Noise Treshold

seekBar.description: Touch Screen on CHARGER/USB (Move Filter) (default=47)
seekBar.name: CHRG Move Filter

settingsPane.description: Master Headphone Gain Amplification Settings Thanks to Gokhanmoral!
settingsPane.name: Headphone Amplification

spinner.description: Headphone Amplifier Level (0-3 which corresponds to 0dB, 1.5dB, 3dB, 6dB)
spinner.name: Headphone Amplifier

settingsPane.description: More Headphone Amplification + Speaker Amplification + MIC Gain
settingsPane.name: Volume Levels and Gain Control

seekBar.description: Headphone Amplification Level
seekBar.name: Analog Headphone

seekBar.description: Analog MIC GAIN Level
seekBar.name: MIC Gain Level

seekBar.description: Analog Speaker Level
seekBar.name: Speaker Level

settingsPane.description: BackLightNotification and Touchkey related Settings
settingsPane.name: BackLightNotification

spinner.description: This setting will set led behavior in BLN.
spinner.name: BLN Effect

spinner.description: Notification timeout. 0: disabled
spinner.name: notification_timeout

settingsPane.description: Touch Keys Light Settings, here you can set the way touch keys light work
settingsPane.name: Touch Keys Lights Settings

spinner.description: Led timeout. Select 'Use ROM defaults' if your ROM already has led timeout support (requires restart). You will need to use this setting on Samsung ROMs if you want to use led fadeout effect.
spinner.name: led_timeout

checkbox.description: BLN Without Wakelock. You cannot use blinking or breathing effects together with this option. Enabling this will let the CPU sleep during BLN and save battery.
checkbox.name: BLNWW
checkbox.label: BLNWW

checkbox.description: Led fadeout effect. If you are on a Samsung ROM, you need to set touchkey leds to always on or always off and use led timeout in STweaks.
checkbox.name: led-fadeout
checkbox.label: led-fadeout

checkbox.description: Selecting this will activate turning touckey leds on when you touch the screen (only when led timeout is enabled).
checkbox.name: Leds on with touch
checkbox.label: led-on-touch

button.description: Use this button to test bln. BLN will be active after you turn the screen off.
button.name: Test BLN
button.label: Test BLN

seekBar.description: Controls touchpad led voltage level (default: 3000)
seekBar.name: Led Voltage Level

checkbox.description: Automatic touchpad led voltage level. If this one is checked touchpad led voltage level will be ignored.
checkbox.name: Auto Led Voltage
checkbox.label: Auto Led Voltage

settingsPane.description: Here you can activate Auto system: clean, tune, reconfig, resync, and much more
settingsPane.name: CRON TASKS MENU

spinner.description: Main Switch for CRON TASKER ON/OFF, if OFF then all below tasks have no effect!
spinner.name: CRON TASK MAIN SWITCH

button.description: Use this button to test if Cron Task Service is ONLINE and supported!, if main switch is ON, and service is OFFLINE, then ROM Busybox not supporting CRON, update Busybox or ROM.
button.name: Test Cron Task Service
button.label: Test Cron Task Service

checkbox.description: Cron Task to clear RAM cache every HOUR only if CPU is resting(IDLE)! this can improve stability and clean RAM from junk, and get it ready to be used
checkbox.name: RAM Clean Task
checkbox.label: RAM Clean Task Every Hour

checkbox.description: Cron Task to clear APP cache every 4:00AM only if CPU is resting(IDLE)! this can maintain free space on data partition, and clean all old junk.
checkbox.name: DISK Clean Task
checkbox.label: DISK Clean Task Every 4:00AM

checkbox.description: Cron Task to FIX APPS Permissions every 4:40AM only if CPU is resting(IDLE)! this can help to reduce errors, bugs, and FC of Apps
checkbox.name: Permissions Fix Task
checkbox.label: Permissions Fix Task Every 4:40AM

checkbox.description: Cron Task to Zipaling all DATA APPS every 4:50AM only if CPU is resting(IDLE)! this can help to reduce errors, bugs, FC of Apps, and improve apps load speed.
checkbox.name: Zipaling Task
checkbox.label: Zipaling Task Every 4:50AM

button.description: Use this button to check if Cron Task Jobs done as requested, this will show log for all finished jobs.
button.name: Test Cron Task Jobs
button.label: Test Cron Task Jobs

settingsPane.description: Dual Mount-SDCARD and MMC via USB after USB disconnected Dual Mount Disabled! this tweak is working by AUTO, plug USB. turn off the screen and then turn ON, and you get working mounts, to scan your new MEDIA files, use some app to force Media Scan.
settingsPane.name: DUAL MOUNT USB

button.description: Dual Mount USB Switch
button.name: DUAL MOUNT
button.label: Dual Mount

settingsPane.description: Here you can run Fix Permissions, Zipalign, DB Optimization script's with one click! please click one time only, scripts will finish in 2~3Min max, no reboot needed.
settingsPane.name: FIX PERMISIONS + ZIPALIGN + DB OPTIMIZE

button.description: Click here to start fixing.
button.name: FIX PERMISSIONS
button.label: FIX PERMISSIONS

button.description: Click here to start Zipalign ONLY User apps, system may be unresponsive, it's OK, do not use phone for 2Min.
button.name: ZIPALIGN
button.label: ZIPALIGN ALL APPS

button.description: Click here to start Apps DataBase's Optimization, compacting, cleaning and reindexing, will take 2min max.
button.name: DB OPTIMIZATION
button.label: DATABASE OPTIMIZATON

settingsPane.description: Misc Settings
settingsPane.name: Misc Settings

spinner.description: WIFI supplicant scan interval, here you can set the time in sec for WIFI to look for access points when ON, Higher the range, less battery used by WIFI! but if you want WIFI to be off on screen OFF, and you set it in ROM settings!, then set it 60sec, if cortex process ON then no problem, will be set by auto and set your setting on screen ON to 360sec and off to 60sec!
spinner.name: WIFI supplicant scan interval

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable INIT.D scripts RUN on boot, many new ROMS running the init.d scripts by Auto, I also can force running the scripts, so if I run them and ROM run them, we have a problem! all scripts running X2 times, so my force RUN is Disabled by default. if you know that your ROM NOT supporting init.d script RUN, then turn it ON here and reboot.'set checkbox ON'
checkbox.name: INIT.D Scripts RUN control
checkbox.label: INIT.D scripts RUN control

spinner.description: This setting change normal full root ADB to DEV hacked not rooted ADB! that allow to use external apps to upload files and mod them inside the phone!, normal user not need it! DEV ADB is for developers only.
spinner.name: ADB BINARY MODE

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable Android Additional Logs (needs reboot)
checkbox.name: Android Logger
checkbox.label: Android Logger

spinner.description: ZRAM Module settings, here you can shutdown ZRAM or add more compressed RAM to System use.
spinner.name: ZRAM Settings

button.description: ZRAM check for active state
button.name: ZRAM STATS
button.label: ZRAM STATS

spinner.description: GPS Time Zone for faster LOCK! Use your region to fix GPS location!
spinner.name: GPS Region

button.description: Click to see your current GPS ZONE
button.name: GPS ZONE
button.label: GPS ZONE CHECK

spinner.description: This will set the default Awake I/O scheduler. for internal, system, data and external sdcard, default is FIOPS
spinner.name: Default Awake I/O Scheduler

spinner.description: This will set the STANDBY/DEEPSLEEP I/O scheduler. for internal, system, data and external sdcard, default is NOOP
spinner.name: STANDBY/DEEPSLEEP I/O Scheduler

spinner.description: Change USB connection mode. Either leave it as default or force it to mass storage mode (you will see your sdcards as disks) or mtp
spinner.name: USB Mass Storage Mode

checkbox.description: If checked, BetterBatteryStatus will report discrete (non-overlapping) wakelock statistics.
checkbox.name: Discrete Wakelock Stats
checkbox.label: Discrete Wakelock Stats

seekBar.description: Battery AC Charge Current Setting
seekBar.name: Battery AC Charge Current

seekBar.description: Battery MISC Charge Current Setting
seekBar.name: Battery MISC Charge Current

seekBar.description: Battery USB Charge Current Setting
seekBar.name: Battery USB Charge Current

button.description: If you think that the fuel gauge chip is behaving weird use this button to reset it. Give it a few hours after you reset the gauge. It may still show you funny values for that period, Then the battery percentage should be fine.
button.name: Reset Fuel-Gauge Chip
button.label: Reset Fuel-Gauge Chip

button.description: Do DATA and CACHE file system check and repair on boot. this is VERY DANGEROUS option! before activating it do full backup with titanium backup! or any kind of backup! if you have lots of damage in your DATA, after fix and repair, ROM may NOT BOOT anymore! In that case reinstall ROM, if still no BOOT, you will have to format DATA file system via recovery, use this with your own risk, this is not a toy function! YOU BEEN WARNED!, this function works only for main rom, second rom get no effect and by default it's OFF, it's also one time action, push the botton to Activate, push again to Abort!
button.name: FIX Filesystem on BOOT
button.label: FIX DATA ON/OFF

button.description: Do clean the media cache on your sdcard, push again to Abort, You have to reboot for action to work!!!
button.name: Clean media-cache
button.label: FIX MEDIA ON/OFF

button.description: Do clean WIFI DHCP IP Lease, push the botton to Activate!
button.name: Clean WIFI Lease
button.label: Clean WIFI Lease

settingsPane.description: Remove OR Reinstall ROOT, You can have ROOTED or not ROOTED phone.
settingsPane.name: Remove OR Reinstall Root

button.description: Root Install, Click to install ROOT (SuperUser) + ROM busybox if existed in case you have used the remove button, to Reinstall ROOT first REMOVE it, this function depend on CORTEX Process Enabled!
button.name: ROOT INSTALL
button.label: INSTALL ROOT

button.description: Root Remove/Uninstall, Click to remove Any ROOT installed + busybox (kernel busybox remain, but hidden from system) to install ROOT check the Auto-Install Root and REBOOT.
button.name: ROOT REMOVE
button.label: REMOVE ROOT

button.description: Root Check, Click to see if you have ROOT or Not
button.name: ROOT Check
button.label: ROOT CHECK

checkbox.description: If checked, installs root on the next restart.
checkbox.name: Auto-Install Root
checkbox.label: Auto-Install Root

settingsPane.description: Dual-Boot Settings. Warning: No confirmation will be asked for reboot buttons.
settingsPane.name: Dual-Boot Settings

button.description: Reboot into custom recovery which let you configure, clone or backup the 2ndROM
button.name: Reboot into Recovery
button.label: Reboot into 2ndROM Utils

button.description: Reboot into 1stROM
button.name: Reboot into 1stROM
button.label: Reboot into 1stROM

button.description: Reboot into 2ndROM
button.name: Reboot into 2ndROM
button.label: Reboot into 2ndROM

checkbox.description: Check this if you don't want boot logo to be shown. If this options is checked boot logo will not be shown even if you have 2ndROM installed.
checkbox.name: No boot-logo
checkbox.label: No boot-logo

spinner.description: Default ROM to boot into. If you don't have 2ndROM installation 1stROM will be booted. If you press the home or volume-down buttons during the boot logo the alternative ROM will be booted, i.e. 1stROM will be booted if the default ROM selection is the 2ndROM.
spinner.name: Default ROM

settingsPane.description: Here you can manage cortexbrain-tune script
settingsPane.name: Automation Script tuning.

spinner.description: Enable or Disable the 'background-process' from 'cortexbrain-tune.sh'. If you disable it! well you loose kernel AI that maintain your device. After Enable wait 2sec, then push the `CHECK SERVICE` to see if service is online.
spinner.name: Cortexbrain-Background-Process

button.description: Cortex service checker, Click to see if cortexbrain 'background-process' is running or not
button.name: CORTEX Service check
button.label: CHECK SERVICE

spinner.description: Here you can control android logger `logcat` you can set it to auto, then you will have logs on screen ON, when screen will be off, logger will be disabled to save battery, if you set Debug, it will be working non stop! if Disabled, then OFF no metter what. tweak depend on cortex proccess ON, if USB/Charger connected! and using Auto mode, logger will not be disabled so we can debug.
spinner.name: Android Logger control

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable the 'Wifi turns off while screen is off'-function. depend on Cortexbrain-Background-Process!
checkbox.name: Auto-Wifi
checkbox.label: Force Auto-Wifi

checkbox.description: Here you can Allow WIFI to use LOW PWR when Screen is OFF(when ON back to high PWR), if not set, we use HIGH PWR and get fast wifi transfers on screen OFF
checkbox.name: Wifi Low PWR Switch
checkbox.label: Wifi Low PWR

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable the 'Auto-Brightness'-function. depend on Cortexbrain-Background-Process!
checkbox.name: Auto-Brightness
checkbox.label: Force Auto-Brightness

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable the 'Firewall-Tweaks'. (To update after change REBOOT)
checkbox.name: Firewall-Tweaks
checkbox.label: Firewall-Tweaks

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable the 'TCP-Tweaks'. (To update after change REBOOT)
checkbox.name: TCP-Tweaks
checkbox.label: TCP-Tweaks

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable the 'IPv6 Network'. (Default is OFF, To update after change, turn OFF screen and turn ON after 3sec!)
checkbox.name: IPv6 Tweaks
checkbox.label: IPv6 ON/OFF

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable the 'CPU-Tweaks'. (To update after change, turn OFF screen and turn ON after 3sec!)
checkbox.name: CPU-Tweaks
checkbox.label: CPU-Tweaks

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable the 'Memory-Tweaks'. (To update after change REBOOT)
checkbox.name: Memory-Tweaks

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable the 'Battery-Tweaks'. (To update after change REBOOT)

checkbox.name: I/O-Tweaks
checkbox.label: I/O-Tweaks

settingsPane.description: Here you can Backup / Restore your STWEAKS settings after installing new kernel, when you restore STWEAKS app will be closed and your settings will be committed! Some settings will work only after reboot!, wait till STWEAKS restart with new settings! restore will take 30sec, just wait here!
settingsPane.name: STweaks Settings Backup / Restore.

button.description: Backup STweaks User Settings!
button.name: Settings Backup
button.label: BACKUP NOW

button.description: Restore STweaks User Settings!
button.name: Settings Restore
button.label: RESTORE NOW

settingsPane.description: Here you can Reinstall/Update your STweak app to one that added to kernel, it's will be installed to system and if you had STweak in DATA, it's will be removed. app will close and you get it back from kernel in 5sec
settingsPane.name: STweaks Reinstall/Update.

button.description: Push to Reinstall/Update STweaks app.
button.name: STweaks Reinstall/Update
button.label: STweaks Reinstall/Update

settingsPane.description: Here you can Add/Update/Remove AD Blocker! `You need ROOT to do the tweak!` if we update the blocker, you can push the `UPDATE AD NOW`, to get the new one installed!, if you install new ROM, and want to use AD BLOCKER, then push `UPDATE AD NOW` and REBOOT, if you need to REMOVE AD-B use the REMOVE button and REBOOT
settingsPane.name: AD Blocker menu.

button.description: ADD/UPDATE AD BLOCKER
button.name: AD-B UPDATE/ADD
button.label: UPDATE AD-B NOW

button.description: REMOVE AD Blocker
button.name: AD-B REMOVE
button.label: REMOVE AD-B NOW

settingsPane.description: Here you can choose some profiles. You can also switch the default profiles (battery, default, performance) via Kernel-Recovery.
settingsPane.name: STweaks Profiles.

settingsPane.description: Debug to SD-Card (/sdcard) ...
settingsPane.name: Bug-Report

button.description: Bug-Report for Kernel
button.name: Kernel-Bug
button.label: KERNEL-BUG

button.description: Bug-Report for Apps
